comments:
I have a local CVS server set up. I find the results of CVS automated test 
suite to be highly inconsistent, sometimes I get the overall sucess rate to 
be   -Infinity and it had never ran for 100%.

I have configured a Linux m/c as CVS server and running the CVS test suite from 
HP-UX PA_RISC. I am able to perform the CVS operations via eclipse(manually). 
But the automated test suite is not running satisfactorily.

I have pasted the error message (from the resulting html file) below.

testVersionTag Error The server reported an error while performing the "cvs 
tag" command.

We run the test suites everynight and pass consistently on release builds. Note
that we run our tests against CVS server version 1.11.16.

Have installed CVS server version 1.11.16 (as mentioned in your response) and 
ran the CVS automated tests. Still I find that the following test cases are 
failing.

1. testEditUnedit 2. testCommit 3. testEditMergeUnedit .... 
Pasted below is the exception trace.

-Ragavendran.

The errors you are seeing indicate a problem setting read-only files 
writtable. There is a fragement provided by Core that is required to do this. 
Do you have the proper fragment loaded (there is one for HP-UX and a different 
one for HP-UX PA_RISC)? Also, what Eclipse build are you testing with?

As I understand, the test cases 1. testEditUnedit 2. testCommit 3. 
testEditMergeUnedit are in WatchEditClass.java.

The first test case "testReadOnlyCheckout" is passing.. and second case 
testEditUnedit which has similar test is failing.

"There is a fragement provided by Core that is required to do this. 
Do you have the proper fragment loaded ?" Can you elaborate on which fragment 
should be available & how to check whether it is loaded or not ? I would like 
to double check in this regard. 

We are testing on 3.0.1 RC2 and we have see this bug for atleast the last 5 
builds.

If the DDL is missing, there will be an entry in the log file (wording is 
something like "Core Resources DDL could no tbe found". You can also look in 
your eclipse/plugins directory for the plugin org.eclipse.coe.resource.hp-ux.

Hi Michael, 

 You are right again. While packaging for HP-UX, the permissions for ".so" 
files are lost. Due to this, the execute permission for libcore*.so or dll was 
lost. It just had the read & write permission. 

 On changing these permissions and running the test suite against released 
Eclipse 3.0.1, passed the CVS test cases 100%. 

  Will check again with another build also.
 
 Thanks for your time. 

-Balu
Closing since this works now for the reporter.
